medical_history.chief_complaint: Repetitive episodes of skin lacerations and subcutaneous hemorrhage after minor trauma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced episodes of skin lacerations and subcutaneous hemorrhage since childhood, with intractable hair loss being a major concern. At age 36, she developed massive intraabdominal hemorrhages due to rupture of the superior mesenteric artery. At age 45, she exhibited signs of hair with a kinky texture, generalized thinning, joint laxity, and multiple other physical findings.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral congenital hip dislocation requiring fixation with a brace; spinal disc herniation.
medical_history.family_history: No skin hyperextensibility, fragility, or joint hypermobility noted in her mother, elder sister, or two daughters.
